intro: Microgynella, commonly known as the smallleaf lily, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Liliaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are herbaceous perennials native to North America. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink. Microgynella species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Their botanical significance lies in their role as part of the diverse flora of eastern North America.
